parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 2.02

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> This command is an alias for <tt>[[compile]](Final) (prefixHeader + [[preprocessFileLineNumbers]] path)</tt>. See description of [[preprocessFileLineNumbers]] for more details. <template><title>Wiki</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Stub</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>pr</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> System

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> [[<template><title>PAGENAMEE</title></template>]] [path, final, prefixHeader]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> path: [[String]] - Path to script file

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> final: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) Compile final, see [[compileFinal]]

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> prefixHeader: [[String]] - (Optional, default "") Value added at the beginning of the file

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Code]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[compileScript]] ["a3\props_f_enoch\military\equipment\scripts\meteo.sqf"]; 
<template lineStart="1"><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>has the same functionality as</value></part></template> 
[[compile]] [[preprocessFileLineNumbers]] "a3\props_f_enoch\military\equipment\scripts\meteo.sqf";</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[compile]] [[compileFinal]] [[preprocessFileLineNumbers]] [[preprocessFile]] [[call]] [[spawn]]
</value></part></template></root>
